Economic Growth: A well-educated population would contribute to economic growth. High-quality education would equip individuals with the skills and knowledge needed to innovate and create new products and services, which would in turn create new jobs and stimulate economic growth.
Social Mobility: Free education would provide a pathway for social mobility, allowing individuals from disadvantaged backgrounds to improve their social and economic status through education.

Reduced Inequality: With access to free, high-quality education, income inequality could be reduced as individuals from all socioeconomic backgrounds would have the opportunity to acquire the skills and knowledge needed to secure well-paying jobs.

Improved Health and Well-being: Education is linked to better health outcomes, and free education would ensure that everyone has access to the information and resources needed to maintain good health.
Environmental Sustainability: Education about environmental issues could be more widespread, leading to greater awareness and action to protect the planet.
